intro: Aeschynanthus pulcher, commonly known as the golden flame plant, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from orange to red. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its foliage is glossy and dark green, providing a striking contrast to its colorful blooms. Aeschynanthus pulcher is popular in horticulture for its ornamental value and ease of cultivation under proper conditions.
